script_keeper module¶

class script_keeper.ScriptKeeper(publisher)[source]¶

Bases: object

The ScriptKeeper class handles all things shell script

The ScriptKeeper class is intended to be instantiated to a ScriptKeeper object useful for aggregating all things shell script related.

ot_config file aggregates useful information for reference

Todo:
  1. Formalize format and keywords of data returning from shell otone_scripts (read_progress())

Change the hostname

script_keeper.change_wifi_mode(data)[source]¶

Change wifi mode (NONE, AP(access point), WIFI(wifi network))

script_keeper.connection()[source]¶

Check internet connection

Returns:string – ‘offline’ or ‘online’

Get ethernet interface’s ip address

Get ESSID from iwconfig

script_keeper.per_data()[source]¶

Fetch data to be sent periodically to browser

script_keeper.poweroff()[source]¶

Send the poweroff command

script_keeper.read_progress(string)[source]¶

Read data coming back from shell scripts and process accordingly

The data coming back follows a certain format that is not set in stone. It could be changed to json and the keywords are yet to be formalized.

Todo:
  1. Formalize format and keywords of data returning from shell otone_scripts
script_keeper.reboot()[source]¶

Send the reboot command

script_keeper.restart()[source]¶

Restart the Crossbar WAMP router and Python backend.

By default, does not change networking configuration.

script_keeper.scan_wifi_networks(data)[source]¶

Scan wifi networks

script_keeper.set_connection_status(num)[source]¶

script_keeper.share_inet()[source]¶

Triggers ethernet interface (eth0) to try to obtain ip address via dhcp by taking it down, and then bringing it up

script_keeper.update(updatee)[source]¶

Old update command

script_keeper.write_led(num, val)[source]¶

Turn an LED on or off.

Not currently implemented. This is in anticipation of having LED indicators
